Getting started with Applets

Introduction

An Applet or Hardware Applet is a software code which can be loaded and executed on FPGA processors of Silicon Software frame grabbers. An Applet offers on-board image acquisition and processing functions which are running in real-time without any load of the host CPU. Each applet covers functions which are necessary for certain operations. For example, the functionality of a line camera trigger differs from the one of an area camera trigger. To operate the frame grabber, it is necessary to initialize it with one applet.

An applet represents a certain, predefinded set of acquisition and image processing functions. For example, an applet may incorporate a Camera Link Full interface in combination with noise filter, Bayer decoding, flat field correction, a lookup table (LUT), and a trigger module. Applets can be parameterized.

An Applet has to be loaded onto the frame grabber for using its functionality as defined part of a certain image acquisition system. After loading the Applet, the specific image processing and image acquisition functions are immediately available.

You can load, unload, and reload applets unlimited times, on some frame grabber models (mE4) even during power-on phase by overwriting the currently installed applet.

Silicon Software offers two different frame grabber series, comprising about 20 different models: A-Series and V-Series. Both series support various camera interfaces at the moment: Camera Link, GigE Vision, LVDS, and CoaXPress.

There are four different Applet types available - AcquisitionApplets, Advanced AcquisitionApplets, SmartApplets and VA (VisualApplets) Applets.

AcquisitionApplets cover a basic set of acquisition and real-time image processing functions. AcquisitionApplets are available for all frame grabber models - microEnable IV and microEnable 5, A-Series and V-Series, Camera Link, GigE Vision, LVDS, and CoaxPress based.

Advanced AcquisitionApplets are a set of enhanced acquisition applets for specific microEnable IV frame grabbers. For the following frame grabber models, Advanced AcquisitionApplets are available:

  • microEnable IV AD4-CL
  • microEnable IV AD4-PoCL
  • microEnable IV VD4-CL
  • microEnable IV VD4-PoCL
  • microEnable IV AD4-LVDS
  • microEnable IV AQ4-GE
  • microEnable IV AQ4-GPoE
  • microEnable IV VQ4-GE
  • microEnable IV VQ4-GPoE


SmartApplets are application-related image processing libraries. The available Smart Applets are bundled in SmartApplets families. Each family contains various SmartApplets that relate to the same thematic area and address a certain industry, application, or technology. SmartApplets are continuously enhanced. SmartApplets are available for V-Series frame grabbers.


VA Applets are individually created applets with a custom functionality, programmed with the graphical programming tool VisualApplets. VA Applets are available for V-Series frame grabber.



Applets and Frame Grabber Models

A-Series Frame Grabbers

All Silicon Software A-Series frame grabbers support AcquisitionApplets. Some microEnable IV A-Series frame grabbers also support Advanced AcquisitionApplets. In the following table, all currently available A-Series frame grabber models and their specific applet support are listed:

Frame Grabber Model Camera Interface AcquisitionApplets Advanced
AcquisitionApplets
microEnable IV AS1-PoCL Camera Link yes -
microEnable IV AD1-CL Camera Link yes -
microEnable IV AD1-PoCL Camera Link yes -
microEnable IV AD1-mPoCL Camera Link yes -
microEnable IV AD4-CL Camera Link yes yes
microEnable IV AD4-PoCL Camera Link yes yes
microEnable IV AD4-LVDS LVDS yes yes
microEnable IV AQ4-GE GigE Vision yes yes
microEnable IV AQ4-GPoE GigE Vision yes yes
microEnable 5 AQ8-CXP6B CoaXPress yes -
microEnable 5 AQ8-CXP6D CoaXPress yes -
microEnable 5 AD8-PoCL Camera Link yes -

Note: A detailled overview over all available applets and functions can be found in the section Applets.


V-Series Frame Grabbers

All Silicon Software V-Series frame grabbers support AcquisitionApplets, VA Applets and model-dependent SmartApplets. Some microEnable IV V-Series frame grabbers also support Advanced AcquisitionApplets. In the following table, all currently available V-Series grabber models and their specific applet support are listed:

Frame Grabber Model Camera Interface AcquisitionApplets Advanced
AcquisitionApplets		 SmartApplets VA Applets
microEnable IV VD1-CL Camera Link yes - yes yes
microEnable IV VD4-CL Camera Link yes yes yes yes
microEnable IV VD4-PoCL Camera Link yes yes yes yes
microEnable IV VQ4-GE GigE Vision yes yes yes yes
microEnable IV VQ4-GPoE GigE Vision yes yes yes yes
microEnable 5 VQ8-CXP6B CoaXPress yes - yes yes
microEnable 5 VQ8-CXP6D CoaXPress yes - yes yes
microEnable 5 VD8-PoCL Camera Link yes - yes yes

Note: A detailled overview over all available applets and functions can be found in the section Applets.


Importants Remarks

  • Handling and usage are basically the same for all applet types:
    - You can load applets and control (start, stop, configuration) a certain acquisition setup using the viewer software microDisplay. OR
    - You can load applets and control (start, stop, configuration) a certain acquisition setup using functions of the Silicon Software API, the powerful Software Development Kit (SDK).
  • AcquisitionApplets and Advanced AcquisitionApplets require no runtime license.
  • Some SmartApplets families require a runtime licence , e.g., the "Segmentation and Object Classification" SmartApplets family.
  • VA applets require a runtime licence when operators out of specific add-on libraries are used, e.g., out of the "blob" or "compression" library.
